column4: hi; I upgraded to Ubuntu 9.10, and now the sound is gone; any hints on how to get it back ?
first of all, in a terminal:  uname -a
Linux spirou 2.6.31-14-generic #48-Ubuntu SMP Fri Oct 16 14:04:26 UTC 2009 i686 GNU/Linux
ok. now give:  aplay -l
use a pastebin, http://paste.ubuntu.com
http://pastebin.org/56013
ok. now, did you try to setup your sound in system → prefs → sound?
oh
hmm ok. eh, try running:  alsamixer -Dhw
also, give:  ps -A | grep pulse
http://pastebin.org/56016
ok. eh, you could install pavucontrol and gnome-alsamixer
i know, gnome apps :S
to setup your pulseuadio and check your hardware volume levels
alsamixer has the volume set to 100%
eh, did oyu run it with the -Dhw option?
that seems to be default; I just run "alsamixer"
eh, if you have pulse and you just run it wihtout -Dhw, it will only show the pulse software volumes
you need to run it with the -Dhw to access your hardware volumes
I couldn't see a difference between "alsamixer" and "alsamixer -Dhw"
hmm ok
and everything is up?
everything that should be, yes
eh, you could install pavucontrol or event padevchooser, you may need to check your pulse prefs.
